Papaya ( #NONGMO )  can prevent different forms of #cancer, lower blood sugar, heal wounds, enhance digestive health, lower your risk for heart disease, and more!

This tropical fruit is also an #antiinflammatory food thats abundant in many benefits to your health and wellbeing. You definitely will not be discarding the seeds into the trash once you are aware of the healthy perks they give. 
You can scoop about a tablespoon of the seeds and consume with the fruit. You can crush them up in a mortar with a pestle. The seeds can be placed in a small jar in the fridge for no more than 7 days. Put in the freezer if you want to keep them longer, you just have to thaw them before usage. 
They can be dried in the sun or in a dehydrator. When fully dried out, pound them up or put in your food processor to grind up into a powder form that can be put in your food. Add in a tablespoon of papaya seeds to your soups, salads, smoothies, or in your everyday cooking!

Begin with consuming no more than a tablespoon a day, whether it be from the fruit or raw, or put into your food. If you can hold it down in your stomach, eat up to 2 tablespoons a day without any side effects. Eat these in moderation as when consumed in excess, your body could react to it.

Papaya has positive effects on the digestive tract due to its potent anti-parasite and antibacterial properties, that are so powerful in eliminating harmful micro-organisms in the intestines. 
The seeds in papaya have flavonoids and phenolic that are potent #antioxidants that stop the growth of tumor cells. The seeds also contain a phytonutrient, isothiocyanate, which works great to prevent cancer in the prostate, colon, breast and lungs. 
#Papayaseeds have been used in traditional Chinese medicine for many centuries to repair liver function by eliminating toxins. Those who have a fatty liver (liver cirrhosis), could benefit as well.

There are two crucial enzymes in the seeds of #papaya, chymopapain and papain, that help to reduce inflammation in the body from joint pains, #asthma, gout and #arthritis. 
Source: http://www.organicandhealthy.org/2017/05/how-to-eat-papaya-seeds-to-detoxify.html#drsebi #beardynatural

Agrochemical giant Monsanto hired internet trolls to combat negative perceptions about their brand on social media and across the internet, according to a lawsuit filed by U.S. Right to Know, a nonprofit organization “working for transparency and accountability” in the American food system. The company has also been accused of manufacturing scientific research to support their products.

The allegations come amid 50 lawsuits, filed in a U.S. district court in San Francisco, that claim “exposure to Roundup herbicide caused them or their loved ones to develop non-Hodgkin lymphoma, and that Monsanto covered up the risks,” as summarized by U.S. Right to Know in a press release.

In a court document dated April 24, the plaintiffs’ attorneys accused Monsanto of operating a program called “Let Nothing Go.” The program is allegedly intended “to leave nothing, not even facebook comments, unanswered; through a series of third parties, it employs individuals who appear to have no connection to the industry, who in turn post positive comments on news articles and Facebook posts, defending Monsanto, its chemicals, and GMOs.” According to the document, this alleged program was revealed in the deposition of David Heering, who works in Monsanto’s U.S. technology development department.

The document also alleges that Monsanto hires think thanks to spread information favoring the company. “Monsanto quietly funnels money to ‘think tanks’ such as the ‘Genetic Literacy Project’ and the ‘American Council on Science and Health,’ organizations intended to shame scientists and highlight information helpful to Monsanto and other chemical producers,” the filing claims.

The allegations regarding the Genetic Literacy Project have been somewhat confirmed by outside reporting, though it is unclear whether Monsanto funded the organization directly. Still, the company has indisputable ties to the organization and reportedly requested favorable coverage from scientists there.

E per quanto ognuno possa aver pensieri diversi, ancora mi stupisce sapere che c'é sempre chi discrimina qualcosa di universale come l'amore. Non so se é più rabbia o delusione quella che provo quanto sento "Non tollerare certi amori" perché sono la prima a non riuscire a fare distinzione di categorie. Non sono né mi sento Dio per decidere chi deve amare chi o cosa e continuo a stranirmi quando qualcuno pronuncia "Non può/Non deve/Non é normale" perché nella mia mentalità definisco anormalità l'odio, la violenza non l'amore. Per quanti ce ne saranno d'intolleranti o solo apparentemente consenzienti, son ben felice di sapere che c'é chi lo é realmente, chi, come me, come primo pensiero ha "Basta che tu sia felice"

Here's a liver with macronodular cirrhosis being observed in a surgery! 
Liver cirrhosis is an end result of an underlying pathology. It develops when scar tissue replaces the normal, healthy tissue of the  liver.
Notice the large nodules separated by wider scars are irregularly distributed throughout the liver, which occurs  usually due to an infectious agent such as viral hepatitis which does not diffuse uniformly throughout the liver. 
Usually, such liver damage cannot be reversed, but treatment can delay further progression and reduce complications. 
Liver transplantation is necessary when complications develop and liver cease to function.

Stomach Acid

Jeremiah 30:17. Everyone has experience with sickness because either we have a disease ourselves or have a loved one who has one. With heart disease, cancer, diabetes, and many other diseases spreading through our society, we may wonder why God allows illnesses. Some illnesses are our own fault because we practice unhealthy habits while other medical problems are not our fault because they are genetic. God may allow us to get sick for several reasons. Sickness often makes us vulnerable, brings us closer to God, and gets our attention when we are not focused on Him and ignoring Him. God can also use our sickness to show His power and ability to others by giving us strength and healing us. Whenever we are sick, we should pray to God to restore our health, heal us, and give us strength to battle our illness. He is the great Healer, the most knowledgeable doctor, and will cure us if it is His will for us.
